SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.azeckoski.reflectutils
Class FieldUtils

java.lang.Object
  org.azeckoski.reflectutils.FieldUtils

public class FieldUtils
extends Object

Class which provides methods for dealing with the fields in objects and classes, this provides the core functionality for the reflect util class

Setting and getting fields supports simple, nested, indexed, and mapped values:
Simple: Get/set a field in a bean (or map), Example: "title", "id"
Nested: Get/set a field in a bean which is contained in another bean, Example: "someBean.title", "someBean.id"
Indexed: Get/set a list/array item by index in a bean, Example: "myList[1]", "anArray[2]"
Mapped: Get/set a map entry by key in a bean, Example: "myMap(key)", "someMap(thing)"

Author:
Aaron Zeckoski (azeckoski @ gmail.com)

getFieldType

public Class<?> getFieldType(Class<?> type,
                             String name)
Finds the type for a field based on the given class and the field name

Parameters:
type - any class type
name - the name of a field in this class (can be nested, indexed, mapped, etc.)
Returns:
the type of the field (will be Object if the type is indeterminate)

obj - any object

Returns:
the type of the field (will be Object if the type is indeterminate)
Throws:
FieldnameNotFoundException - if the name is invalid for this obj
IllegalArgumentException - if the params are null

getFieldTypes

public Map<String,Class<?>> getFieldTypes(Class<?> type,
                                          ClassFields.FieldsFilter filter)
Get the types of the fields of a specific class type
returns the method names as fields (without the "get"/"is" part and camelCased)

Parameters:
type - any class
filter - (optional) indicates the fields to return the types for, can be null for defaults
Returns:
a map of field name -> class type

getFieldValues

public Map<String,Object> getFieldValues(Object obj)
Get the values of all readable fields on an object (may not all be writeable)

Parameters:
obj - any object
Returns:
a map of field name -> value
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the obj is null

getFieldValues

public Map<String,Object> getFieldValues(Object obj,
                                         ClassFields.FieldsFilter filter,
                                         boolean includeClassField)
Get the values of all fields on an object but optionally filter the fields used

Parameters:
obj - any object
filter - (optional) indicates the fields to return the values for, can be null for defaults
WARNING: getting the field values from settable only fields works as expected (i.e. you will an empty map)
includeClassField - if true then the value from the "getClass()" method is returned as part of the set of object values with a type of Class and a field name of "class"
Returns:
a map of field name -> value
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the obj is null

getFieldValue

public Object getFieldValue(Object obj,
                            String name)
Get the value of a field on an object, name can be nested, indexed, or mapped

Parameters:
obj - any object
name - the name of a field on this object
Returns:
the value of the field
Throws:
FieldnameNotFoundException - if this field name is invalid for this object
IllegalArgumentException - if there is a failure getting the value

setFieldValue

public void setFieldValue(Object obj,
                          String name,
                          Object value)
Set the value of a field on an object (automatically auto converts), name can be nested, indexed, or mapped

Parameters:
obj - any object
name - the name of a field on this object
value - the value to set the field to (must match target exactly)
Throws:
FieldnameNotFoundException - if this field name is invalid for this object
IllegalArgumentException - if there is a failure setting the value

setFieldValue

public void setFieldValue(Object obj,
                          String name,
                          Object value,
                          boolean autoConvert)
Set the value of a field on an object (optionally convert the value to the field type), name can be nested, indexed, or mapped

Parameters:
obj - any object
name - the name of a field on this object
value - the value to set the field to
autoConvert - if true then the value will be converted to the target value type if it is possible, otherwise the value must match the target type exactly
Throws:
FieldnameNotFoundException - if this field name is invalid for this object
IllegalArgumentException - if there is a failure setting the value
UnsupportedOperationException - if this value cannot be auto converted to the type specified

setIndexedValue

public void setIndexedValue(Object indexedObject,
                            int index,
                            Object value)
For setting an indexed value on an indexed object directly, indexed objects are lists and arrays
NOTE: If the supplied index is invalid for the array then this will fail

Parameters:
indexedObject - any array or list
index - the index to put the value into (will append to the end of the list if index < 0), must be within the bounds of the array
value - any value, will be converted to the correct type for the array automatically
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if there is a failure because of an invalid index or null arguments

unpackNestedName

protected FieldUtils.Holder unpackNestedName(String fullName,
                                             Object object,
                                             boolean autoCreate)
Traverses the nested name path to get to the requested name and object

Parameters:
fullName - the full path name (e.g. thing.field1.field2.stuff)
object - the object to traverse
autoCreate - if true then create the nested objects to force successful traversal, else will throw NPE
Returns:
a holder with the nested name (e.g. stuff) and the nested object
Throws:
NullPointerException - if the path cannot be traversed
IllegalArgumentException - if the path is invalid

getSimpleValue

protected Object getSimpleValue(Object obj,
                                String name)
For getting a value out of a bean based on a field name
WARNING: Cannot handle a nested/mapped/indexed name

Throws:
FieldnameNotFoundException - if this field name is invalid for this object
IllegalArgumentException - if there is failure

getIndexedValue

protected Object getIndexedValue(Object obj,
                                 String name)
For getting an indexed value out of an object based on field name, name must be like: fieldname[index], If the object is an array or a list then name can be the index only: "[1]" or "[0]" (brackets must be included)
WARNING: Cannot handle a nested/mapped/indexed name

Throws:
FieldnameNotFoundException - if this field name is invalid for this object
IllegalArgumentException - if there is a failure
FieldGetValueException - if there is an internal failure getting the field

getMappedValue

protected Object getMappedValue(Object obj,
                                String name)
For getting a mapped value out of an object based on field name, name must be like: fieldname[index]
WARNING: Cannot handle a nested/mapped/indexed name

Throws:
FieldnameNotFoundException - if this field name is invalid for this object
IllegalArgumentException - if there are invalid arguments
FieldGetValueException - if there is an internal failure getting the field

getValueOfMap

protected Object getValueOfMap(Map map,
                               String name)
For getting a value out of a map based on a field name which has a key in it, name is expected to be the key for the map only: e.g. "mykey", if it happens to be of the form: thing[mykey] then the key will be extracted
WARNING: Cannot handle a nested name or mapped/indexed key

Returns:
the value in the map with a key matching this name OR null if no key found

findFieldValue

protected Object findFieldValue(Object obj,
                                ClassProperty cp)
This will get the value from a field, for internal use only, Reduce code duplication

Parameters:
obj - any object
cp - the analysis object which must match the given object (defines the field)
Returns:
the value for the field
Throws:
FieldGetValueException - if there is failure
IllegalArgumentException - if inputs are invalid (null)
FieldGetValueException - if there is an internal failure getting the field

setSimpleValue

protected void setSimpleValue(Object obj,
                              String name,
                              Object value)
Set a value on a field of an object, the types must match and the name must be identical
WARNING: Cannot handle a nested/mapped/indexed name

Throws:
FieldnameNotFoundException - if this field name is invalid for this object
IllegalArgumentException - if there is failure
FieldSetValueException - if there is an internal failure setting the field

WARNING: Cannot handle a nested/mapped/indexed name

Throws:
FieldnameNotFoundException - if this field name is invalid for this object
IllegalArgumentException - if there is a failure
FieldSetValueException - if there is an internal failure setting the field

Throws:
FieldnameNotFoundException - if this field name is invalid for this object
IllegalArgumentException - if there is failure
FieldSetValueException - if there is an internal failure setting the field

setValueOfMap

protected void setValueOfMap(Map map,
                             String name,
                             Object value)
Set a value on a map using the name as the key, name is expected to be the key for the map only: e.g. "mykey", if it happens to be of the form: thing[mykey] then the key will be extracted
WARNING: Cannot handle a nested name or mapped/indexed key

Parameters:
obj - any object
cp - the analysis object which must match the given name and object
value - the value for the field
Throws:
FieldSetValueException - if there is failure
